facts: Wrote approximately 37 plays and 154 sonnets during the English Renaissance (1564-1616)
Invented over 1,700 words still used in English today, including 'assassination' and 'lonely'
Performed at the Globe Theatre in London and was part-owner of the theater company
His works explore universal themes of love, power, betrayal, and human nature
Born in Stratford-upon-Avon to a middle-class family, father was a glover and alderman
Married Anne Hathaway at 18 and had three children, including twins Hamnet and Judith
His plays were performed for both common people and royalty, including Queen Elizabeth I
Left behind very few personal documents, creating ongoing debates about his life and identity
